alert.note: Alert for DeKalb (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 2:17PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern DeKalb County through 300 PM CDT... At 217 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Rainsville, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Fort Payne, Rainsville, Valley Head, Hammondville, Pine Ridge, Lebanon, Dog Town, Collbran, Adamsburg, and Desoto State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
